name: Lava Canyon (Mt. St. Helens)
description:
Introduction

A beautiful "show canyon" carved out by lahars (super-heated mud flows) during the 1980 eruption of Mt. St. Helens. A popular trail network circles / descends the canyon.

  • As of 2022: the upper suspension bridge has been closed limiting options to an out & back on either side of the loop.
  • The trail has been closed periodically due to flood damage or slides. Please respect all closures.

Approach

Descent

Exit

Red tape

Please resist the temptation to run Lava Canyon. Off-trail travel is prohibited here as there have been numerous fatalities. This area is also a high-tourist zone and is extremely popular. Individuals climbing, rappelling, or slack-lining around such "show waterfalls" are far more likely to garner negative reactions from the general public at large. Negative reactions can lead to complaints, which means more rules for canyoneers by local land managers.

A NW Forest Pass is required to park at the trailhead.
